Thank you for your explanation. 

Your method "1b" provides the additional =
ability for a "higher-power" 
to designate roles on the fly, not only as a =
function of position.

...then...

...if you expanded the definition of "no=
de" to allow 1-to-n unique 
inputs and 1-to-m unique outputs, you could emb=
ed (i.e. "seed") the 
trained genotype and/or pheonotype(s) back into a CPP=
N and/or 
substrate, without having to resort to method "1a".

My new motto=
: "On the road to the general AI, any shortcut is fair 
game."
